entries.name: Age
entries: Crablites reach maturity around age 15 and can live up to 200 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Crablites are generally chaotic, due to being raised removed from society. They also tend to be neutral and prefer to be left alone.

entries.name: Size
entries: Crablites are between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh between 200 and 300 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet. You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: While you wear no armor, your AC is equal to 12 + your Constitution modifier. You may wield a shield and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Crushing Claws
entries: Your unarmed strikes inflict bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier. You crush your foes with your claw.

entries.name: Clumsy Claws
entries: Doing anything gentle and delicate with your hands is quite challenging unless you have spent considerable time training them to do a specific task (i.e casting spells, using certain tools, writing, etc...).

entries.name: Death Grip
entries: You have advantage on any Strength checks or saving throws related to gripping something.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character..
What doesn't kill you, usually succeeds in the second attempt.

entries.name: Societal Outcasts
entries: Crablites are a half crab half triton breed, the product of a triton father and a giant crab mother. This union is conventionally seen as a transgression against nature. Thus, they are not recognized as tritons or giant crabs in underwater society. This means that Crablites are often societal outcasts.

Crablites are rare. There exists no Crablite settlements or civilisations. They usually raise themselves, learning to survive in the underwater wilderness. Some Crablites have learned to adapt and be part of societies on land. Their triton genes allow them to breathe above water with ease.

entries.name: Faceless Names
entries: Crablites adopt naming conventions of whatever society they adapt to.
